description: Enable to ensure that the request will not delete or modify any existing Asset Book Rules.

Asset_BookObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_BookObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_BookObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Book_Rule_Data.description: Reference to an asset book to which the asset bool rules apply.

Asset_Book_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: This is a unique reference identifier to the set of asset book rules.
Used to define the order of the rules (ascending).

Spend_Category_or_HierarchyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Spend_Category_or_HierarchyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Spend_Category_or_HierarchyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Book_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to existing spend categories or spend category hierarchies to which the asset book rule applies.

Asset_ClassObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_ClassObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_ClassObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Book_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to existing asset classes to which the asset book rule applies.

Asset_TypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_TypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Book_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to existing asset types to which the asset book rule applies.

OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

OrganizationObjectID.type: WID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Region_Reference_ID
OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Book_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to existing companies or company hierarchies to which the asset book rule applies.

validation.validation: One or more companies for a rule for Spend Category ([spend category]) have a company currency that does not match the currency specified.

CurrencyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

CurrencyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

CurrencyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Book_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to an existing currency to which the asset book rule applies. This is required if Greater than Amount is specified.
The amount above which the asset book rule applies.

Business_Asset_Amount_BasisObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_Asset_Amount_BasisObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_Asset_Amount_BasisObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Book_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to UNIT or EXTENDED Amount basis reference. This is required when specifying 'Greater Than Amount'.

validation.validation: Either amount, currency and amount basis must all be entered, or all three fields must be blank.

Accounting_TreatmentObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Accounting_TreatmentObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Accounting_TreatmentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Book_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to the resulting accounting treatment for the asset book rule.

validation.validation: When spend category is intangible, asset book rules should return accounting treatment of Depreciable Capital.
Select a valid accounting treatment. The Inventory Asset accounting treatment isn’t valid for assets.

Depreciation_ProfileObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Depreciation_ProfileObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Depreciation_ProfileObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Book_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to the resulting depreciation profile for the asset book rule.

validation.validation: Depreciation profile is required for depreciable capital accounting treatments. If accounting treatment is expense or non-depreciable capital, then depreciation profile should be blank.

Asset_Book_Rule_Data.description: Element containing asset book rule replacement data

validation.validation: Use another ID for the Asset Book Rule or unset the Add Only attribute. An Asset Book Rule already exists for the ID [ID].
validation.description: The Put Asset Book Rules web service cannot be used to edit an existing rule; it can only add rules, or replace all rules.

description: Element containing the Asset Book and all its corresponding Asset Book Rules
